0.question: Please list the reference names of the drivers who are eliminated in the first period in race number 18.
0.GT_SQL: SELECT T2.driverRef FROM qualifying AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 ON T2.driverId = T1.driverId WHERE T1.raceId = 18 ORDER BY T1.q1 DESC LIMIT 5
actual_evidence: driver reference name refers to driverRef
first qualifying period refers to q1
drivers who are eliminated in the first qualifying period refers to 5 drivers with MAX(q1)
race number refers to raceId
generic_evidence: 'reference names of the drivers' refers to drivers.driverRef
'eliminated in the first period' refers to qualifying.q1
'reference names of the drivers who are eliminated in the first period' refers to drivers.driverRef WHERE qualifying.q1 DESC LIMIT 5
'race number' refers to qualifying.raceId

1.question: What is the surname of the driver with the best lap time in race number 19 in the second period?
1.GT_SQL: SELECT T2.surname FROM qualifying AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 ON T2.driverId = T1.driverId WHERE T1.raceId = 19 ORDER BY T1.q2 ASC LIMIT 1
actual_evidence: race number refers to raceId
second qualifying period refers to q2
best lap time refers to MIN(q2)
generic_evidence: 'race number' refers to qualifying.raceId
'the second period' refers to qualifying.q2
'best lap time' refers to ORDER BY qualifying.q2 ASC LIMIT 1

generic_evidence: 'circuits in Shanghai' refers to circuits.location = 'Shanghai'

53.question: What is the rate of drivers completing all the laps in the 2008 Australian Grand Prix?

actual_evidence: completing all the laps refers to time is not null
rate = divide(COUNT(raceID where time is not null), COUNT(raceID))
generic_evidence: 'the rate of drivers completing all the laps' refers to CAST(SUM(IIF(results.time IS NOT NULL, 1, 0)) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(results.resultId)

58.question: Please calculate the race completion percentage of Japanese drivers from 2007 to 2009.
58.GT_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(IIF(T1.time IS NOT NULL, 1, 0)) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(T1.raceId) FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId INNER JOIN drivers AS T3 on T1.driverId = T3.driverId WHERE T3.nationality = 'Japanese' AND T2.year BETWEEN 2007 AND 2009
actual_evidence: from 2007 to 2009 refers to year between 2007 and 2009
race completion refers to time is not null
percentage = Divide(COUNT(DriverID where time is not null and year between 2007 and 2009),Count (DriverID where year between 2007 and 2009))*100
generic_evidence: 'from (100) to (100)' refers to races.year BETWEEN 100 AND 100
'the race completion' refers to results.time IS NOT NULL
'race completion percentage' refers to CAST(SUM(IIF(results.time IS NOT NULL, 1, 0)) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(results.raceId)

champion refers to rank = 1

62.question: From 2000 to 2005, what percentage of drivers who were born before 1985 and the lap numbers were over 50?
62.GT_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(IIF(STRFTIME('%Y', T3.dob) < '1985' AND T1.laps > 50, 1, 0)) AS REAL) * 100 / SUM(IIF(STRFTIME('%Y', T3.dob) < '1985', 1, 0)) FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId INNER JOIN drivers AS T3 on T1.driverId = T3.driverId WHERE T2.year BETWEEN 2000 AND 2005
actual_evidence: born before 1985 refers to year(dob)<1985
in 2000 to 2005 refers to year between 2000 and 2005
percentage = Divide(COUNT(driverId where year (dob) <1985 and laps >50),COUNT(DriverID where year between 2000 and 2005) *100
generic_evidence: 'born before (100)' refers to STRFTIME('%Y', drivers.dob) < '100'
'From (100) to (100)' refers to T2.year BETWEEN 100 AND 100

'percentage of drivers who were born before 1985 and the lap numbers were over 50' refers to CAST(SUM(IIF(STRFTIME('%Y', drivers.dob) < '1985' AND results.laps > 50, 1, 0)) AS REAL) * 100 / SUM(IIF(STRFTIME('%Y', drivers.dob) < '1985', 1, 0))

63.question: How many driver participated in race ID number 18?
63.GT_SQL: SELECT COUNT(driverId) FROM target WHERE raceId = 18

64.question: State code numbers of top 3 yougest drivers. How many Brazillian drivers among them?
64.GT_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT T1.nationality FROM drivers AS T1 INNER JOIN lapTimes AS T2 ON T1.driverId = T2.driverId ORDER BY T1.dob DESC LIMIT 3 ) AS T3 WHERE T3.nationality = 'Brazillian'
actual_evidence: youngest driver refers to Max (year(dob))
generic_evidence: 'State code numbers of top 3 youngest drivers' refers to drivers.dob DESC LIMIT 3

65.question: State the racing year which has the fastest lap time?
65.GT_SQL: SELECT T2.year FROM lapTimes AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId ORDER BY T1.time LIMIT 1
actual_evidence: fatest lap time refers to Min(time)
generic_evidence: 'the fastest lap time' refers to ORDER BY lapTimes.time LIMIT 1

66.question: On what year did the youngest driver had his first qualifying race? State the name, date and time of the race.
66.GT_SQL: SELECT T3.year, T3.name, T3.date, T3.time FROM qualifying AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 on T1.driverId = T2.driverId INNER JOIN races AS T3 on T1.raceId = T3.raceId WHERE T1.driverId = ( SELECT driverId FROM drivers ORDER BY dob DESC LIMIT 1 ) ORDER BY T3.date ASC LIMIT 1
actual_evidence: youngest driver refers to Max (year(dob))
generic_evidence: 'youngest driver' refers to ORDER BY drivers.dob DESC LIMIT 1

67.question: What is the website of the constructor who tallied the most total wins.
67.GT_SQL: SELECT T1.url FROM constructors AS T1 INNER JOIN constructorStandings AS T2 on T1.constructorId = T2.constructorId ORDER BY T2.wins DESC LIMIT 1

generic_evidence: 'website of the constructor' refers to constructors.url

68.question: In which race did the fastest 1st lap time was recorded? Please indicate the time in milliseconds.
68.GT_SQL: SELECT T1.raceId FROM lapTimes AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId WHERE T1.lap = 1 ORDER BY T1.time LIMIT 1

generic_evidence: 'fastest 1st lap time' refers to MIN(lapTimes.time)

69.question: What is the average fastest lap time of the top 10 drivers in the 2006 United States Grand Prix?
69.GT_SQL: SELECT AVG(T1.fastestLapTime) FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId WHERE T1.rank < 11 AND T2.year = 2006 AND T2.name = 'United States GrAND Prix'
actual_evidence: top 10 refers to rank <11
AVG(fastestLapTime)

70.question: List down top 5 German drivers who has the shortest average pit stop duration and were born between 1980-1985.
70.GT_SQL: SELECT T2.forename, T2.surname FROM pitStops AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 on T1.driverId = T2.driverId WHERE T2.nationality = 'German' AND STRFTIME('%Y', T2.dob) BETWEEN '1980' AND '1985' GROUP BY T2.forename, T2.surname ORDER BY AVG(T1.duration) LIMIT 5
actual_evidence: born between 1980-1985 refers to 1980< year(dob)>1985
Average pitstop duration refers to Divide(SUM(duration),COUNT(duration))
shortest average refers to Min(avg(duration))

'average pit stop duration' refers to AVG(pitStops.duration)
'top 5 shortest average pit stop duration' refers to ORDER BY AVG(pitStops.duration) LIMIT 5

71.question: Who is the champion of the Canadian Grand Prix in 2008? Indicate his finish time.
71.GT_SQL: SELECT T2.time FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId INNER JOIN drivers AS T3 on T1.driverId = T3.driverId WHERE T2.name = 'Canadian GrAND Prix' AND T2.year = 2008 ORDER BY T2.time DESC LIMIT 1
actual_evidence: the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond" in which Max(time)
generic_evidence: 'the champion of the race finish time' refers to ORDER BY races.time DESC LIMIT 1

year(dob) BETWEEN '1971' AND '1985'

'hosted the most recent race' refers to ORDER BY races.date DESC LIMIT 1

name of racer = forename, surname

Youngest racer = MIN(dob)

80.question: During which lap did Lewis Hamilton take a pit stop during the 2011 Australian Grand Prix?
80.GT_SQL: SELECT T1.lap FROM pitStops AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 on T1.driverId = T2.driverId INNER JOIN races AS T3 on T1.raceId = T3.raceId WHERE T2.forename = 'Lewis' AND T2.surname = 'Hamilton' AND T3.year = 2011 AND T3.name = 'Australian GrAND Prix'

83.question: Please list the lap records for the circuits in Italy.
83.GT_SQL: SELECT T1.time FROM lapTimes AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId INNER JOIN circuits AS T3 on T2.circuitId = T3.circuitId WHERE T3.country = 'Italy'

84.question: In which Formula_1 race was the lap record for the Albert Park Grand Prix Circuit set?

85.question: What was the average time in milliseconds Lewis Hamilton spent at a pit stop during Formula_1 races?
85.GT_SQL: SELECT AVG(milliseconds) FROM pitStops AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 on T1.driverId = T2.driverId WHERE T2.forename = 'Lewis' AND T2.surname = 'Hamilton'
actual_evidence: average time in milliseconds spent at pit stop refers to AVG(milliseconds)
generic_evidence: 'average time in milliseconds spent at a pit stop' refers to AVG(pitStops.milliseconds)

86.question: What is the average lap time in milliseconds of all the lap records set on the various circuits in Italy?
86.GT_SQL: SELECT CAST(SUM(T1.milliseconds) AS REAL) / COUNT(T1.lap) FROM lapTimes AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 on T1.raceId = T2.raceId INNER JOIN circuits AS T3 on T2.circuitId = T3.circuitId WHERE T3.country = 'Italy'
actual_evidence: average = AVG(milliseconds)
generic_evidence: 'average lap time in milliseconds' refers to CAST(SUM(lapTimes.milliseconds) AS REAL) / COUNT(lapTimes.lap)
